required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy in Reducing Fractures and Safety of Zoledronic Acid in Men With Osteoporosis
clinical_study.official_title: A Two Year Multicenter, Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled, Parallel Group Study to Evaluate the Fracture Efficacy and Safety of Intravenous Zoledronic Acid 5 mg Annually for the Treatment of Osteoporosis in Men

brief_summary.textblock: This study will investigate if the drug zoledronic acid given once yearly is safe and has beneficial effects in treating osteoporosis by reducing bone loss and fractures in men with osteoporosis.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With at Least One New Morphometric Vertebral Fracture Over 24 Months
primary_outcome.description: Vertebral fracture (VF) was assessed based on morphometry. QM(quantitative morphometry) incident VF(QM positive) is defined by at least 20% decrease in vertebral height of at least 4mm. If participant had QM positive at any vertebrae at any visit, x-rays from visits for participants were evaluated using Genant semi-quantitative method for VF assessment: Grade1 Mild VF is defined as 20-24% decrease in anterior, middle, and/or posterior vertebral height. Grade2 moderate VF is defined as 25-40% decrease in vertebral height. Grade3 Severe VF is defined as more than 40% decrease in vertebral height

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With at Least One New Morphometric Vertebral Fracture Over 12 Months
secondary_outcome.description: Vertebral fracture (VF) was assessed based on morphometry. QM(quantitative morphometry) incident VF(QM positive) is defined by at least 20% decrease in vertebral height of at least 4mm. If participant had QM positive at any vertebrae at any visit, x-rays from visits for participants were evaluated using Genant semi-quantitative method for VF assessment: Grade1 Mild VF is defined as 20-24% decrease in anterior, middle, and/or posterior vertebral height. Grade2 moderate VF is defined as 25-40% decrease in vertebral height. Grade3 Severe VF is defined as more than 40% decrease in vertebral height

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With at Least One New Moderate or Severe Morphometric Vertebral Fracture Over 12 Months
secondary_outcome.description: Moderate or severe vertebral fracture (VF) was assessed based on morphometry. A QM (quantitative morphometry) incident VF(QM positive) was defined by at least a 20% decrease in any vertebral height (at least 4 mm). If a participant had a QM positive at any vertebrae at any visit,x-rays from all visits for participants were evaluated using Genant semi-quantitative (SQ) method for VF assessment. Grade 2 moderate VF was defined as a 25-40% reduction in any vertebral height.Grade 3 Severe: VF was defined as more than 40% reduction in any vertebral height.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With at Least One New Moderate or Severe Morphometric Vertebral Fracture Over 24 Months
secondary_outcome.description: Moderate or severe vertebral fracture (VF) was assessed based on morphometry. A QM (quantitative morphometry) incident VF(QM positive) was defined by at least a 20% decrease in any vertebral height (at least 4 mm). If a participant had a QM positive at any vertebrae at any visit,x-rays from all visits for participants were evaluated using Genant semi-quantitative (SQ) method for VF assessment. Grade 2 moderate VF was defined as a 25-40% reduction in any vertebral height.Grade 3 Severe: VF was defined as more than 40% reduction in any vertebral height.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With at Least One New or Worsening Morphometric Vertebral Fracture Over 12 Months
secondary_outcome.description: Worsening vertebral fracture (VF) was assessed based on morphometry. QM (quantitative morphometry) incident VF(QM positive) was defined by at least a 20% decrease in any vertebral height (at least 4 mm). If a participant had a QM positive at any vertebrae at any visit, x-rays from all visits for participants were evaluated using Genant semi-quantitative (SQ) method for VF assessment. A worsening fracture was defined as an SQ reading that was greater than the baseline SQ reading, which was at least 1 (prevalent fracture)

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With at Least One New or Worsening Morphometric Vertebral Fracture Over 24 Months
secondary_outcome.description: Worsening vertebral fracture (VF) was assessed based on morphometry. A QM (quantitative morphometry) incident VF(QM positive) was defined by at least a 20% decrease in any vertebral height (at least 4 mm). If a participant had a QM positive at any vertebrae at any visit,x-rays from all visits for participants were evaluated using Genant semi-quantitative (SQ) method for VF assessment. A worsening fracture was defined as an SQ reading that was greater than the baseline SQ reading, which was at least 1 (prevalent fracture)

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change in Height From Baseline
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from Baseline to 12 months and 24 months
secondary_outcome.description: Height was measured using a stadiometer. Two measurements were taken in millimeters (mm), and repeated if the two measurements differed by greater than 4 mm. The average of the two (or four) height measurements was used for analysis

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With First Clinical Vertebral Fracture
secondary_outcome.description: Clinical vertebral fracture is a painful vertebral fracture which came to clinical attention, e.g., with increased back pain, impairment of mobility or functional limitations. Subjects who did not experience a fracture event were censored at the end of study. End of study was defined as the last visit or date of death, whichever was earlier.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With First Clinical Fracture
secondary_outcome.description: Clinical fracture is painful fracture in any site which came to clinical attention, e.g., with increased pain, impaired mobility or functional limitations. Subjects who did not experience fracture were censored at end of study. End of study was defined as the earlier of last visit or date of death.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With First Non-vertebral Fracture
secondary_outcome.description: Non-vertebral fracture is any fracture which was not of the vertebrae. Subjects who did not experience a fracture event were censored at the end of study. End of study was defined as the last visit or date of death, whichever was earlier.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage Change From Baseline in Lumbar Spine Bone Mass Density (BMD)
secondary_outcome.description: Dual energy x-ray absorptiometry (DXA) Least Square Means (LSM) were analyzed using an ANCOVA model with treatment and baseline value as explanatory variables. Percent change in BMD at lumbar spine at Months 6, 12, and 24 relative to baseline as measured by DXA in a subset of at least 100 evaluable subjects at selected sites. Percentage change from baseline = 100*(endpoint - baseline)

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage Change From Baseline in Total Hip BMD (g/CM^2)
secondary_outcome.description: Dual energy x-ray absorptiometry (DXA) Least Square Means (LSM) were analyzed using an ANCOVA model with treatment and baseline value as explanatory variables. Percent change in total hip BMD at Months 6, 12, and 24 relative to baseline as measured by DXA in a subset of at least 100 evaluable subjects at selected sites. Percentage change from baseline = 100*(endpoint - baseline)

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage Change From Baseline in Femoral Neck BMD (g/CM^2)
secondary_outcome.description: Dual energy x-ray absorptiometry (DXA) Least Square Means (LSM) were analyzed using an ANCOVA model with treatment and baseline value as explanatory variables. Percent change in total femoral neck BMD at Months 6, 12, and 24 relative to baseline as measured by DXA in a subset of at least 100 evaluable subjects at selected sites. Percentage change from baseline = 100*(endpoint - baseline)

secondary_outcome.measure: Serum Beta C-terminal Telopeptides of Type I Collagen(b-CTx) by Visits
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Month 3, Month 6, Month 12, Month 15, month 18, Month 24

arm_group.description: 5 mg/100 ml administered via a peripheral intravenous site as a slow infusion over 15 minutes. The intravenous (i.v.) infusion was delivered via vented infusion line (to allow constant flow) and 20-22 gauge angiocatheter, and preceded and followed by a 10 ml normal saline flush of the intravenous line for a total volume infused of 120 ml once a year.

100 ml Placebo administered via a peripheral intravenous site as a slow infusion over 15 minutes. The i.v. infusion was delivered via vented infusion line (to allow constant flow) and 20-22 gauge angiocatheter, and preceded and followed by a 10 ml normal saline flush of the intravenous line for a total volume infused of 120 ml once a year.

intervention.description: Zoledronic acid 5 mg iv given once a year.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
• Osteoporosis as defined by very low bone mineral density in the hip and spine or low bone mineral density in the hip combined with presence of 1-3 mild or moderate fractures of the vertebrae
Exclusion Criteria:
- Low Vitamin D
- Renal insufficiency
- Previous treatment with certain anti-osteoporotic therapies (except after certain washout periods): calcitonin, bisphosphonates, parathyroid hormone (PTH), sodium fluoride, strontium ranelate,
- Previous treatment with testosterone, anabolic steroids or growth hormone
- Chronic use of systemic corticosteroids (oral or i.v.) within the last year
- History of any cancer or metastases within the last 5 years
- History of brittle bone disease, multiple myeloma, or Paget's disease, or any other metabolic bone disease, except osteoporosis
- Bilateral hip replacements
Other protocol-defined inclusion/exclusion criteria may apply

group.title: Zoledronic Acid
group.description: 5 mg/100 ml administered via a peripheral intravenous site as a slow infusion over 15 minutes. The intravenous (i.v.) infusion was delivered via vented infusion line (to allow constant flow) and 20-22 gauge angiocatheter, and preceded and followed by a 10 ml normal saline flush of the intravenous line for a total volume infused of 120 ml once a year.

group.description: 100 ml Placebo administered via a peripheral intravenous site as a slow infusion over 15 minutes. The intravenous (i.v.) infusion was delivered via vented infusion line (to allow constant flow) and 20-22 gauge angiocatheter, and preceded and followed by a 10 ml normal saline flush of the intravenous line for a total volume infused of 120 ml once a year.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With at Least One New Morphometric Vertebral Fracture Over 24 Months
outcome.description: Vertebral fracture (VF) was assessed based on morphometry. QM(quantitative morphometry) incident VF(QM positive) is defined by at least 20% decrease in vertebral height of at least 4mm. If participant had QM positive at any vertebrae at any visit, x-rays from visits for participants were evaluated using Genant semi-quantitative method for VF assessment: Grade1 Mild VF is defined as 20-24% decrease in anterior, middle, and/or posterior vertebral height. Grade2 moderate VF is defined as 25-40% decrease in vertebral height. Grade3 Severe VF is defined as more than 40% decrease in vertebral height
outcome.population: Modified Intent-to-treat (mITT) population included all randomized subjects who had a baseline and at least one post-baseline assessment of the primary efficacy variable. In this analysis, missing Month 24 fractures were imputed using LOCF.

outcome.population: The ITT (intent to treat) population consisted of all subjects as randomized.

group.title: Zoledronic Acid
group.description: 5 mg/100 ml administered via a peripheral intravenous site as a slow infusion over 15 minutes. The intravenous (i.v.) infusion was delivered via vented infusion line (to allow constant flow) and 20-22 gauge angiocatheter, and preceded and followed by a 10 ml normal saline flush of the intravenous line for a total volume infused of 120 ml once a year.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: 100 ml Placebo administered via a peripheral intravenous site as a slow infusion over 15 minutes. The intravenous (i.v.) infusion was delivered via vented infusion line (to allow constant flow) and 20-22 gauge angiocatheter, and preceded and followed by a 10 ml normal saline flush of the intravenous line for a total volume infused of 120 ml once a year.

measure.title: Number of Participants With First Non-vertebral Fracture
measure.description: Non-vertebral fracture is any fracture which was not of the vertebrae. Subjects who did not experience a fracture event were censored at the end of study. End of study was defined as the last visit or date of death, whichever was earlier.
measure.population: The ITT (intent to treat) population consisted of all subjects as randomized.

outcome.title: Percentage Change From Baseline in Lumbar Spine Bone Mass Density (BMD)
outcome.description: Dual energy x-ray absorptiometry (DXA) Least Square Means (LSM) were analyzed using an ANCOVA model with treatment and baseline value as explanatory variables. Percent change in BMD at lumbar spine at Months 6, 12, and 24 relative to baseline as measured by DXA in a subset of at least 100 evaluable subjects at selected sites. Percentage change from baseline = 100*(endpoint - baseline)
outcome.population: Intent-to-treat (ITT) population included all randomized subjects who had a baseline and at least one post-baseline assessment of the efficacy variable.

outcome.title: Serum Beta C-terminal Telopeptides of Type I Collagen(b-CTx) by Visits
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Month 3, Month 6, Month 12, Month 15, month 18, Month 24
outcome.population: The ITT, Intent to Treat population, includes all participants who received a single a dose of treatment and had data available for analysis. n = the number of subjects with evaluable measurements at visit, as determined by the efficacy window.

Small cell lung cancer extensive stage

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The terms and conditions of Novartis' agreements with its investigators may vary. However, Novartis does not prohibit any investigator from publishing. Any publications from a single-site are postponed until the publication of the pooled data (i.e., data from all sites) in the clinical trial; or the publication of the trial results in their entirety.
